intro: Doornia reflexa, commonly known as the reflexed doornia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale pink to white flowers. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a waxy coating. Doornia reflexa is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands.
